results.title: It came to stay
results.creator_credit: Jack Gardiner, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the motor industry in Australia from approximately 1904 and shows the significant changes that have taken place in this field. The film shows the production of motor cars from molten metal to finished product.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Gardiner, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions

results.title: Misleading cases
results.creator_credit: Michael O'Connell, Russell Porter and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: A dramatised film of a lecture to medical students. Professor Bruce Kerr shows the ethical dilemma in dealing with cases, of not diagnosing the medical problem correctly. Doctors should look not only at the symptoms presented by the patients but also at their social situation which may also reveal the cause. He points out that medicine is the art of insight into the human condition. (Contains footage of Northcote and University of Melbourne.)

results.title: Miserables
results.creator_credit: Glenn Jordan, Norman Rosemont and ITC Entertainment
results.brief_description: Victor Hugo’s magnificent tale of the triumph of good over evil is a powerful story of pursuer and pursued. Set in France at the turn of the 18th Century, it follows a handsome young woodcutter, Jean Valjean (Richard Jordan), who is savagely sentenced for stealing a loaf and bears the burden of his guilt throughout his life. Befriended by a Bishop, he vows to lead a life of kindness and morality which he does but he is pursued by the obsessed Police Inspector Javert (Anthony Perkins), over a period of 20 tortured years until Javert commits suicide. Interwoven is a tale of the love between Cossette (Caroline Langrishe), the adopted daughter of Valjean, and Marius (Christopher Guard), who leads a group of insurrectionists against the Republic. The film’s climatic sequence is Government troops assaulting the rebel barricades and the subsequent uniting of the young couple.

results.title: Marvellous Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Charles Cozens Spencer and Spencer Productions
results.brief_description: In this silent film approximately 15 static and moving shots, including those from a cable car, are separated by intertitles. They take on a Lumiere look with the way that they picture Melbourne’s main streets and buildings that were prominent at the time. The different fashion and the horse and cart transportation are even more fascinating in this familiar setting.

results.title: Marusska and Wolf Castle
results.creator_credit: Edgar Dutka, Vlasta Pospislova, Miroslav Kubricht, BFA Films and Video, Phoenix Films and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: Animated adaptation of the traditional Moravian tale of Marusska, a poor mountain girl, who dares to enter a haunted wolf castle and subsequently suffers the curse of the she-wolf.

results.title: Martin Scorsese directs
results.creator_credit: Steven Fischer, Joel Sucher and Pacific Street Film Projects
results.brief_description: This documentary visits the set, the editing rooms and the mixing studios during the production of “Goodfellas”. It also includes many clips from his body of work including “Mean Streets”, “Raging Bull”, “New York, New York” and “The Last Temptation of Christ”, as well as interviews with the director, his family, friends and colleagues from the film world such as Steven Spielberg, Robert De Niro, Harvey Keitel, Joe Pesci, and George Lucas.

results.title: Martin Luther King: The Legacy
results.brief_description: An excellent documentary which not only looks at the life and work of Dr. Martin Luther King, but at how his dream for an integrated United States has been realised today. Interviews with participants of the Civil Rights Movement, friends and family of Dr. King and those who sought to destroy him such as the FBI. As well as fascinating archival footage, there is also an excellent soundtrack which features Afro-american music contemporary to the era.

results.title: On the Right Track
results.brief_description: A Department of Conservation, Forests and Lands Program. Examines the Code of Forest Practices which was set to ensure careful logging use of our valuable forests to protect them for future generations.

results.title: On the Line
results.creator_credit: David Greig, John Richardson, SBS-TV and Kestrel Films & Video (Australia)
results.brief_description: It’s a harsh, lonely life for the men, mostly European migrants, who work maintaining the railway around Redmont in north-west Western Australia. Labouring through searing heat over 426 kilometres of mountainous, desert region, these men talk candidly about their lives, providing psychological and social insight into what it is to be living in “isolation”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Greig, John Richardson, SBS-TV and Kestrel Films & Video (Australia)

results.title: On the move
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Alex Ezard, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Sister Audrey Tomlinson and a team of several other nurses and aides describe their work and conditions. They travel around Queensland caring for Aborigines, and teach them basic preventive medicine.
